bibl.title: Report from Walter Reed to the Adjutant General, April 30, 1901

div1.p: Walter Reed details his activities for the month of April 1901. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Report from Walter Reed to the Adjutant General, April 30, 1901
div1.opener:
All communications to this Office should be addressed “To the Surgeon General, U. S. Army, Washington, D. C.”
Subject: Station & Duty.
Adjt. Genl's. Office,
MAY 1 1901
Returns Division.
WAR DEPARTMENT,
Surgeon General's Office,
U. S. Army Medical Museum and Library,
Corner 7th and B Streets SW.,
Washington, April 30, 1901. ,
TO THE ADJUTANT GENERAL,
U. S. Army.
General:
div1.p:
I have the honor to report that during the month of April
1901, I have been on duty in the Surgeon General's Office as Curator
of the Army Medical Museum in accordance with Par. 2 S.O.No.153, Hdqrs.
of the Army, A.G.O., Washington, July 7, 1893.
div1.closer:
Very respectfully, Walter Reed, Major & Surgeon, U.S. Army,
Curator Army Med. Museum.
